channel.title: Toilet Duck on Tedium: The Dull Side of the Internet.
channel.description: Recent content in Toilet Duck on Tedium: The Dull Side of the Internet.

item.title: Toilet Duck Dynasty
item.description: It’s not easy to come up with a product that’s built around a completely, utterly unique design. Especially involving a topic as unflattering as cleaning a toilet. But in the early 1980s, a man named Walter Düring had such a moment. The Swiss man’s company, Düring AG, had made a name for itself with the concept of decalcification, based on a formula his mother, Maria, came up with. But it was in the early 1980s that the firm had come up with something truly successful on a mainstream stage: A uniquely shaped nozzle that could spray decalcifiers into obscure crevices.
